sen.j: 藤原 長輔（ふじわら の ながすけ、長治元年（1104年） - 久寿3年1月14日 (旧暦)（1156年2月6日））は、平安時代末期の公卿。
sen.e: HUJIWARA no Nagasuke (1104 - February 6, 1156) was a Kugyo (the top court officials) in the end of Heian period.

sen.j: 権中納言・贈太政大臣藤原長実の三男。
sen.e: His was Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor), and the third son of FUJWIARA no Nagazane, zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).

sen.j: 永久 (元号)3年（1115年）、12歳で甲斐守。

sen.j: 元永3年（1120年）左兵衛佐、保安 (元号)元年（1120年）丹後守、従五位上、天治3年（1126年）従四位上、長承3年（1134年）正四位下となるが、異母妹藤原得子が鳥羽上皇の寵愛を受けたことに怒った崇徳天皇によって昇殿を止められる。
sen.e: He became Sahyoe no suke (Assistant Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards) in 1120, Tango no kami (the governor of Tango Province) and Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1120, Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1126, Seihiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1134, but he was prohibited access to the imperial court by Emperor Sutoku, who was angry about his half-sister FUJIWARA no Nariko being favorite of the retired Emperor Toba.

sen.e: He became Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 1141, Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices) in 1148, Bingo no suke (Assistant Governor of Bingo Province) in 1153, Kura no kami (Chief of Kuraryo, Bureau of Palace Storehouses) in 1154, and Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1154 under the Emperor Konoe, who was a child of Nariko.
